      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String theUsername,
         PasswordHashDTO thePasswordHash,
         java.lang.Class<? extends User> theUserType)
           throws InvalidArgumentException,
                  AlreadyLoggedInException,
                  UserDoesNotExistException,
                  PasswordMismatchException
        Description copied from interface: UserManagerLocal
        The method login let a user to login into the program.
        The user name is a non-null and not-empty string used to identify the player and log the player in. The password is a PasswordHashDTO object, that contains the MD5 hash created with the method MD5 of the class HashUtility. The real password is NEVER passed to this function for security purposes.
        Specified by:
        login in interface UserManagerLocal
        Parameters:
        theUsername - is the username of the user
        thePasswordHash - is the MD5 hash of the user's password
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException
        AlreadyLoggedInException
        UserDoesNotExistException
        PasswordMismatchException

      • userPerTypeExists

        public boolean userPerTypeExists(java.lang.String theUsername,
                        java.lang.Class<? extends User> theUserType)
                          throws InvalidArgumentException
        The method userPerTypeExists search an user ONLY in a specific table represented by the argument theUserType.
        If the user doesn't exist in that specified table, the player and log the player in.
        Parameters:
        theUsername - is the username of the user to be searched
        theUserType - is the class type of the table where search the user
        Returns:
        true if the user doesn't exist in that specified table
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - is thrown if theUsername is empty or null or if theUserType is null
